data.event: The H1N1 outbreak of swine flu, which began in Mexico this April, has now spread across the globe.
The H1N1 outbreak of swine flu, which began in Mexico this April, has now spread across the globe.
Brazil had surpassed the United States, which has 593 deaths, in number of total fatalities from the outbreak late in August.

event.title: said that "in the last week or so

data.event: Communications director for the World Health Organisation Vivian Tan said that "in the last week or so, the increase has been quite quick," attributing the rise to a small decrease in temperatures as fall sets in, as well as students returning to school after summer breaks.

event.title: were reported in a two-day period earlier in the week

data.event: China's official news agency Xinhua reported that 1,118 new cases of the influenza were reported in a two-day period earlier in the week, adding that a vast majority of the cases had been transmitted in China, not by persons entering the country from abroad.

event.title: Wednesday, eleven people had been reported

data.event: On Wednesday, eleven people had been reported dead from the virus in India, taking the country's death toll up to 212 people.

event.title: infected with the influenza is now

data.event: The number of people infected with the influenza is now estimated at 6,800.
India's health ministry on Tuesday said that the Tamiflu drug would be on sale in the open market within seven days, allowing for a "restricted sale" of the drug.

event.title: the open market within seven days

data.event: India's health ministry on Tuesday said that the Tamiflu drug would be on sale in the open market within seven days, allowing for a "restricted sale" of the drug.

event.title: is expected that within the next five to seven days

data.event: An unnamed official said that "it is expected that within the next five to seven days, both the drugs would be available in the retail market through identified chemists against proper medical prescriptions.
His estimate is higher than his previous prediction of 1 million cases and 1,000 deaths, made last month.

event.title: were reported in the United Kingdom in recent weeks

data.event: About five thousand new cases of swine flu were reported in the United Kingdom in recent weeks, reversing a declining trend in the number of new infections.
"We don't know whether this is the start of the next big wave that we were expecting this autumn but it is certainly something that's giving us concern.

event.title: will probably be a week or two

data.event: It will probably be a week or two before we see whether this increase is sustained." said Liam Donaldson, the Chief Medical Officer.

event.title: will be given out early in October

data.event: Health Care Secretary Kathleen Sebelius said that free shots will be given out early in October.

event.title: were diagnosed with the swine flu on Wednesday

data.event: 144 people in Vietnam were diagnosed with the swine flu on Wednesday, bringing the total number of infected people in the country to 5,648.
Nguyen Tran Hien, the director of the Central Institute of Hygiene Epidemiology, predicted that the swine flu would peak at the end of 2009 and the beginning 2010.
